instruction: Given the MITRE ATT&CK technique Additional Cloud Credentials (T1098.001), how should I defend?
output: You can defend using the following mitigations: Mitigation ID: M1032 Mitigation name: Additional Cloud Credentials Mitigation description: Use multi-factor authentication for user and privileged accounts. Consider enforcing multi-factor authentication for the CreateKeyPair and ImportKeyPair API calls through IAM policies. Mitigation ID: M1030 Mitigation name: Additional Cloud Credentials Mitigation description: Configure access controls and firewalls to limit access to critical systems and domain controllers. Most cloud environments support separate virtual private cloud (VPC) instances that enable further segmentation of cloud systems. Mitigation ID: M1026 Mitigation name: Additional Cloud Credentials Mitigation description: Do not allow domain administrator or root accounts to be used for day-to-day operations that may expose them to potential adversaries on unprivileged systems. Mitigation ID: M1018 Mitigation name: Additional Cloud Credentials Mitigation description: Ensure that low-privileged user accounts do not have permission to add access keys to accounts. In AWS environments, prohibit users from calling the `sts:GetFederationToken` API unless explicitly required.

instruction: How to mitigate Mitre technique: Defacement (T1491)?
output:
Mitigation ID: M1053 
 Mitigation name: Defacement
 Mitigation description: Consider implementing IT disaster recovery plans that contain procedures for taking regular data backups that can be used to restore organizational data. Ensure backups are stored off system and is protected from common methods adversaries may use to gain access and destroy the backups to prevent recovery.
